transcript.text: [Music]

that they're preparing to bring down

why there are so many indicators that
are flashing red letting us know that

only thing that's keeping it propped up
is the illusion and once the illusion

real economy I mean right now coming
from the Government Accountability
Office they released a new report the

student loan payments owed by baby
boomers coming out of the wall street
journal a total of 1.1 billion has been
garnished since 2001 with a hundred and
seventy 1 million being collected in
2015 alone well if all these individuals
that are who have graduated college and
those who are coming out of college with
these incredible jobs with the

the problem well the problem is is that
individuals can't find jobs the problem
is these high paying jobs they don't
exist yes there are a few here and there
but for the majority of the people they
can't find them they're going for
part-time jobs and they're barely making
it
and what happens is that high student
loan that payment that shows up every
month but they just can't do it this is
why the government stepped in and said
listen we'll adjust the payments
according to what you're making and
we'll spread it out maybe 20 25 years
why would they do that if everything is
fine if people have no problem getting
jobs people making good salaries why in
the world would you need to do this the
only reason is because all of that is
fake it's an illusion there aren't good
jobs this is why we're turning into a
part-time nation we're seeing more and
more full-time jobs completely disappear
and more people are taking on part-time
jobs as they're laid off I think about
this for a second during this incredible
recovery since 2008 we see right now
that young adults are living home with
mom and dad right now just under forty
percent Millennials are barely shy of
the all-time record which was set in
1940 at the end of the Great Depression
we're back then it was forty point nine
percent we're at forty percent again if
unemployment is that four point six
percent they're telling us wearing this
incredible recovery that everything is
great why then are individuals living at
home those who are coming out of college
why can't they find jobs because once
again it's not what it seems and we can
see right now that this is what happened
after the depression they're telling us
we're in a recovery well everything that
we've been looking at we know we're in a
recession what happens when this economy
fails completely that number forty
percent it's going to look more like
seventy percent because we know right
off the bat
jobs are going to completely disappear
and we see right now that things are not

economic indicators are showing that
we're in a recession people right now
are just trying to get by they're using
their credit cards and we see right now
that Americans they're going to exceed
the amount of credit card debt they
racked up during the Great Recession so
we have the young adults living with mom
and dad and at the end of the Great
Recession it was at forty point nine
percent we're at forty percent right now
they can't pay their student loans and
we've Americans have used their credit
cards and racked up the same amount same

percent from 14,000 546 ten years ago
and fifteen thousand seven hundred
sixty-two last year and this is coming
from an analysis from the federal
reserve bank of new york and the US

including mortgages auto loan student
loans is expected to surpass the amount
owed at the beginning of the Great
Recession by the end of 2016 and we can
see right now that the amount of total
household debt is twelve point four
trillion in 2010 it was eleven point
seven trillion we're heading back to the
same exact problems why is credit card
debt moving up because people are having
a very difficult time surviving they're
not making enough money with their
part-time jobs remember when you have a
full-time job you have a certain way of
life you have your car payment you have
your house payment you have your other
monthly payments and when you lose that
job
and you can't find the job making the
same amount of money and you take a part
time job or the same type of job making
less money your problems affording all
of these things now yes you can cut down
on Netflix you can get rid of that you
can get rid of amazon prime and get rid
of that but the water bill stays the

cars that your financing or leasing
those payments stay insurance stays
health insurance stays and it becomes
very very difficult to get through all
of this and this is what people are
finding out right now today in the

pushing the idea that existing home
sales while they're surging like we've
never seen before which is strange
because mortgage rates are increasing
morge applications have declined quite a
bit but existing home sales aren't

well they only look at 20 cities and
they look at this and they say okay
let's see what's happening in this area
and of course they do have hedge fund

houses on the market for a very long

other explanation is people are saying
okay I see the interest rates rising let

now these are the two arguments I'm

the 20 cities and just looking at that
only we see out in Europe well the

looks like the government in Italy
they're going to be stepping in looks
like they're going to be using about 20

where they thought maybe for ten percent

now the corporate media the central

what do you think is going to happen in

no matter what it all depended on how

most likely before the new year and as

and with a snap of a finger the market

well companies are going to be laying

what has been happening it's almost like
in two thousand
where we had this illusion and

this has been a complete set up they
